titlestmt.titleproper: Dorothy E. Withrow collection of World War II memorabilia 1892-1950
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Dorothy E. Withrow collection of World War II memorabilia
did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Dorothy E. Withrow (d. 2000) graduated from the University of Pennsylvania with a degree in education.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of World War I and World War II ephemera collected by Dorothy Withrow and [her father?] John Alexander Withrow. World War II materials include: civil defense information bulletins and rules, registration cards, helmet, arm bands, wooden alarm rattle and signs; war bond advertisements and buttons; Office of War Information and U.S. Food Administration bulletins and magazines; German, British, and American propaganda such as flyers and pamphlets; postcards and greeting cards to Dorothy Withrow; issues of the Saturday Review of Literature, 1940-1944; Philadelphia newspapers from 1939, 1942, and 1945, and the Manchester Guardian, 1939; posters; receipts for knitted garments for the British War Relief Society; and a 1945 published volume on tanks. World War I materials include: printed addresses and articles from 1915-1916; German 100,000 bank note, 1923; Red Cross patches; and a series of pictorial books titled the New York Tribune Photographic History of the Great War. There is also a copy of a 1892 publication titled Historical and Commercial Philadelphia.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
